name: hover
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly

example.eg: A hawk hovered in the sky, waiting to swoop down on its prey.
example.egtrans: 一只老鹰在天空中盘旋，要伺机俯冲捕捉猎物。

example.eg: I heard the noise of a helicopter hovering overhead.
example.egtrans: 我听到头顶上直升飞机盘旋的声音。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stand somewhere, especially near another person, eagerly or nervously waiting for their attention

example.eg: A waiter hovered at the table, ready to take our order.
example.egtrans: 一名侍者守在桌子旁，等着我们点菜。

example.eg: I could sense him behind me, hovering and building up the courage to ask me a question.
example.egtrans: 我能感觉到他在我身后犹豫徘徊，想鼓起勇气问我一个问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay at or near a particular level

example.eg: Inflation is hovering at three percent.
example.egtrans: 通货膨胀率在3%左右徘徊。

trans_examp.trans_en: to put the cursor on a computer screen in a particular place without clicking on it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把光标放在电脑屏幕上的某个位置

example.eg: The link changes to green when the mouse hovers over it.
example.egtrans: 当光标放在链接文字上时，文字会变成绿色。

example.eg: If you hover the mouse pointer over the entry, the full web address will be displayed.
example.egtrans: 当你把光标放在这条记录上时，整个网站地址就会显示出来。
